issues.description: The problem statement text (Part 2, task 7) incorrectly specifies addGuestStudents(String) while the UML and the solution use addGuestStudents(int). This creates a parameter-type conflict: students reading the textual description may implement a method taking a String, but the intended API (UML and tests) expects an int parameter for the number of new guest students. Implementing the wrong parameter type will cause compilation/test mismatches and confusion about the correct method signature.
issues.suggested_fix: Correct the problem statement so the textual task matches the UML and intended implementation: change addGuestStudents(String) to addGuestStudents(int) in the task description (and any example usages). This aligns the description with the UML signature and the solution, avoiding confusion and test/compilation errors. Alternatively, if the intention was to accept a String, update the UML and solution to use a String parameter and clearly document parsing/semantics — but the simpler fix is to make the textual description use int.
